instruction:
Quantum dots are semiconductor nanoparticles that have various applications due to their unique optical and electronic properties. The synthesis of quantum dots usually involves several steps, each of which can impact the final properties of the quantum dots.
Based on the provided synthesis procedure, predict the properties of synthesized quantum dot material, including Valid Quantum Yield, Stability Factor.
input:
# Quantum Dot Synthesis Procedure:
## Step 1
• 10 ml of TOA was added to the flask.
• 0.15 mmol of In(OAc)3 was added.
• 0.15 mmol of Zn(OUn)2 was added.
• The mixture was put under a vacuum.
• The temperature was set to 120 °C for 15 min.

## Step 2
• The temperature was set to 120 °C for 10 min.

## Step 3
• The flask was refilled with N2.
• The temperature was set to 280 °C for 15 min.

## Step 4
• 0.13 mmol of (TMS)3P was added.
• 2 mmol of DPP was added.
• 0.1 mmol of TOP-Se was added.
• The temperature was set to 280 °C for 15 min.

## Step 5
• 0.5 mmol of OT was added.
• The temperature was set to 280 °C for 5 min.

## Step 6
• 0.8 mmol of In(OAc)3 was added.
• The temperature was set to 320 °C for 10 min.

## Step 7
• 6.8 mmol of In(OAc)3 was added.
• 3 mmol of Zn(OAc)2 was added.
• The temperature was set to 320 °C for 20 min.

## Step 8
• The temperature was set to 20 °C for 60 min.

instruction:
Quantum dots are semiconductor nanoparticles that have various applications due to their unique optical and electronic properties. The synthesis of quantum dots usually involves several steps, each of which can impact the final properties of the quantum dots.
Based on the provided synthesis procedure, predict the properties of synthesized quantum dot material, including Valid Quantum Yield, Stability Factor.
input:
# Quantum Dot Synthesis Procedure:
## Step 1
• 400 ml of TOA was added to the flask.
• 26.4 mmol of Zn(OAc)2 was added.
• 52.4 mmol of (TMS)3P was added.
• 1.44 mmol of MA was added.
• The mixture was put under a vacuum.
• The temperature was set to 120 °C for 15 min.

## Step 2
• The temperature was set to 120 °C for 10 min.

## Step 3
• The flask was refilled with N2.
• The temperature was set to 280 °C for 15 min.

## Step 4
• 1.16 mmol of InCl3 was added.
• 1.64 mmol of DPP was added.
• 3.92 mmol of ZnI2 was added.
• 15.6 mmol of Oam was added.
• The temperature was set to 280 °C for 10 min.

## Step 5
• The temperature was set to 280 °C for 5 min.

## Step 6
• 1.6 mmol of (DMA)3P was added.
• The temperature was set to 280 °C for 20 min.

## Step 7
• The temperature was set to 20 °C for 50 min.

• The temperature was set to 120 °C for 10 min.

instruction:
Quantum dots are semiconductor nanoparticles that have various applications due to their unique optical and electronic properties. The synthesis of quantum dots usually involves several steps, each of which can impact the final properties of the quantum dots.
Based on the provided synthesis procedure, predict the properties of synthesized quantum dot material, including Valid Quantum Yield, Stability Factor.
input:
# Quantum Dot Synthesis Procedure:
## Step 1
• 55 ml of ODE was added to the flask.
• 11 mmol of In(OAc)3 was added.
• 13.5 mmol of PA was added.
• 2.25 mmol of (TMS)3P was added.
• 0.15 mmol of 0.4M Zn(OA)2 was added.
• The mixture was put under a vacuum.
• The temperature was set to 90 °C for 5 min.

## Step 2
• The temperature was set to 120 °C for 10 min.

## Step 3
• The temperature was set to 120 °C for 100 min.

## Step 4
• The flask was refilled with N2.
• The temperature was set to 50 °C for 20 min.

## Step 5
• 48 mmol of Zn(OAc)2 was added.
• The temperature was set to 250 °C for 15 min.

## Step 6
• 96 mmol of OA was added.
• The temperature was set to 250 °C for 10 min.

## Step 7
• 16 mmol of Se/TOP was added.
• 4.8 mmol of Zn(OA)2 was added.
• 6.4 mmol of S/TOP was added.
• The temperature was set to 250 °C for 5 min.

## Step 8
• The temperature was set to 20 °C for 40 min.
